intro: Cheiranthus cumbrae, commonly known as the Cumbrian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the British Isles. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, with a distinctive bell-shaped appearance. Cheiranthus cumbrae is a perennial species that thrives in cool, moist environments.
